body_html: @jingjingwang , what does your my_py_func look like? I think the function passed to tf.py_func is purely "numpy"(in tf runtime, we first convert tensor to numpy array), so there must be a sparse object type in numpy that we can convert tf.SparseTensor to.
body_text: @jingjingwang , what does your my_py_func look like? I think the function passed to tf.py_func is purely "numpy"(in tf runtime, we first convert tensor to numpy array), so there must be a sparse object type in numpy that we can convert tf.SparseTensor to.
body: @jingjingwang , what does your `my_py_func` look like? I think the function passed to `tf.py_func` is purely "numpy"(in tf runtime, we first convert tensor to numpy array), so there must be a sparse object type in numpy that we can convert `tf.SparseTensor` to.
